intro: Brachyscome chrysoglossa, commonly known as the golden crown, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounded by a ring of smaller, darker yellow disk florets, creating a striking visual effect. It typically grows in coastal regions and is well adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Brachyscome chrysoglossa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public spaces.
